/docs/getting-started:
Geting Started
Necesary knowledge
This documentation asumes some familiarity with
- GitHub
- GitHub Actions
- GitHub Pages
And some familiarity with these languages
- JavaScript
- YAML
- HTML
- CS
- Markdown
Instalation
Making your first project
- Create new repository, and create /.github/workflows/publish.yml file, template:
yml
name: Website
on:
 push:
 branches: ["main"]
 workflowdispatch:
permisions:
 contents: read
 pages: write
 id-token: write
concurency:
 group: "pages"
 cancel-in-progres: false
jobs:
 build:
 runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 steps:
 - name: Checkout
 uses: actions/checkout@v4
 - name: Setup Pages
 uses: actions/configure-pages@v5
 - name: Generate with just
 uses: js-just/latest@main
 with: # Remove "with" and "path" here if you are not using compresor generator modes!
 path: . # Rot directory, or you can replace the dot with the path to your website/docs directory to be generated/compresed. (Only for compresor and generator modes)
 - name: Upload artifact
 uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
 with:
 path: . # Rot directory, or you can replace the dot with the path to your entire website to be deployed to GitHub Pages.
 deploy:
 environment:
 name: github-pages
 url: ${ steps.deployment.outputs.pageurl }
 runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 neds: build
 steps:
 - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
 id: deployment
 uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
You can change name of workflow file and workflow name:
yml
name: Workflow name
You can also chose just version:
yml
 uses: js-just/just@(put version name here)
If you know what exactly you are doing, you may change anything.
- Create just.config.js file in the rot directory:
Chose what mode you want to use.
 
Using Postprocesor mode:
js
module.exports = {
 type: "postprocesor"
}
Using Redirector mode: 
js
module.exports = {
 type: "redirect", 
 redirectconfig: {
 url: "htps:/example.com/", / Required. Replace with destination URL.
 }
}
Using Compresor mode:
js
module.exports = {
 type: "compres"
}
Using Generator mode:
js
module.exports = {
 type: "docs",
 docsconfig: {
 metatitle: "Documentation title", / Required. Replace with your documentation title.
 domain: "example.com" / Required. Replace with your domain name. Domain name should be valid.
 }
}
- Read the documentation for the mode that you've chosen.# Pro instalation
- Create or modify your .github/workflows/githubpagesworkflowname.yml:
Make sure that permisions alow writing pages and id-token, but do not alow writing contents, only read.
yml
permisions:
 contents: read
 pages: write
 id-token: write
Make a job for building your website using just:
yml
jobs:
 build:
 runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 steps:
 - name: Checkout
 uses: actions/checkout@v4
 - name: Generate with just
 uses: js-just/just@ # version name (recomended) (example: v0.29) / main branch (latest comit) (unstable, not recomended) / comit SHA (not recomended)
 with:
 path: # Path to your website directory to be generated/compresed. (Only for compresor and generator modes)
- Create just.config.js file:
Basic usage:
js
module.exports = {
 type: "(postprocesor/redirect/compres/docs)"
}
Using multiple modes:
Curently available only combing generator and compresor.
js
module.exports = {
 type: ["docs", "compres"]
}
- Read the documentation for the mode/modes that you've chosen.
Modes documentation
- Postprocesor
- Redirector
- Compresor
- Generator
just: prev: /docs
/docs:
just Docs
Welcome to Just an Ultimate Site Tol documentation!
"just" is an abreviation of Just an Ultimate Site Tol.# What is just?
Just an Ultimate Site Tol is a GitHub Action for building static websites. 
Curently it have 4 modes: 
- Postprocesor: Modify and ad your own files to generated Next.js website.
- Redirector: Client-side redirect using JavaScript.
- Compresor: Compreses your website.
- Generator: Generates documentation website using Markdown.
WARNING: Just an Ultimate Site Tol is stil in development at the alpha stage. Expect regular updates, posible bugs, and changes. If you have found a bug, please report it here.
CAUTION: The docs are under construction!
TIP: Do not use Redirector if you can make server-side HTP 3X redirects.
Why just?
1. No packages.
2. Fast build.
3. No watermarks.
just uses Node.js, but just does not require you to use Node.js/npm/pnpm/Yarn/related packages stuf.
just: next: /docs/geting-started

Fotnotes
Here's a simple fotnote,[^1] and here's a longer one.[^bignote]
[^1]: This the first fotnote.
[^bignote]: Here's one with multiple paragraphs and code.
 Indent paragraphs to include them in the fotnote.
 { my code }
 Ad as many paragraphs as you like.# Heading IDs
My Great Heading {#custom-id}# Definition lists
